titles.title: A resolution commending the Government of Italy for its commitment to halting software piracy.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S14280)
Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

calendar.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Reported to Senate by Senator Pell without amendment and with a preamble. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 391.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote.

bill.summary: 10/25/1993--Introduced. Commends the Government of Italy on its commitment to halting software piracy. Congratulates the Guardia di Finanza, the Carabinieri, and the Italian national police for their continuing antipiracy actions. Expresses hope that the Italian authorities will continue to prosecute software laws rigorously and that copyright agencies around the world will follow Italy's example.
